Class Problem

java.lang.Object
Advanced.Problem
class Problem extends Object
Describes an instance of the routing problem. Manages a collection of locations and the roads that connect them.

  • Field Details

    • locations

      private List<Location> locations

    • roads

      private List<Road> roads

  • Constructor Details

    • Problem

      Problem()

  • Method Details

    • addLocation

      public void addLocation(Location loc)
      Adds a new location to the problem instance. The location is only added if it does not already exist in the list.
      Parameters:
      loc - the Location object to be added

    • addRoad

      public void addRoad(Road road)
      Adds a new road to the problem instance. The road is only added if it does not already exist in the list.
      Parameters:
      road - the Road object to be added

    • getLocations

      public List<Location> getLocations()
      Retrieves the list of all locations. Needed by the Dijkstra algorithm to initialize its distances.

    • getRoads

      public List<Road> getRoads()
      Retrieves the list of all roads. Needed by the Dijkstra algorithm to find connected neighbors.

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      Determines if the current problem instance is valid. A problem is valid if all roads connect known locations that exist in the problem.
      Returns:
      true if the problem is valid, false otherwise

    • isReachable

      public boolean isReachable(Location start, Location end)
      Determines if it is possible to travel from a starting location to a destination using the available roads. This uses a Depth-First Search (DFS) algorithm.
      Parameters:
      start - the starting Location
      end - the destination Location
      Returns:
      true if a path exists between the start and end locations, false otherwise

    • dfs

      private boolean dfs(Location current, Location target, List<Location> visited)
